blocks.text: Data protection methods include technical and procedural controls designed to prevent unauthorized access and limit the impact of breaches.
Encryption converts readable data into unreadable formats using cryptographic keys. Without the correct key, encrypted data remains unintelligible even if accessed by attackers.
Tokenization replaces sensitive values with non-sensitive placeholders that have no exploitable meaning. The original data is stored separately in secure systems.
Access controls restrict who can read, modify, or delete data. Role-based access control and attribute-based access control help enforce least privilege.
Data loss prevention systems monitor data movement and block unauthorized transfers. These systems inspect content and context to prevent leaks through email, web uploads, or removable media.
Backup and recovery systems protect against data loss from ransomware, hardware failures, and accidental deletion. Backups must be protected with the same rigor as production data.
No single method is sufficient alone. Effective protection relies on layered controls that address confidentiality, integrity, and availability together.
